intro: Phoradendron mucronatum, commonly known as the Mexican devil's ivy, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in the spring. Its fruit is a legume that splits open to release small, flat seeds. This plant is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it often grows in humid, tropical environments.
